text: En toute honnêteté, un Sushi Shop est un Sushi Shop. Presque toutes les succursales de la bannière se ressemblent, mais celle-ci est un peu différente. Bon, on offre les mêmes sortes de sushis, mais notre expérience est plus agréable encore vu tout le reste.   L'endroit est super propre et le mobilier plus chaleureux que les chaises en plastique des autres restaurants de la chaîne est invitant. On a définitivement envie de déguster nos sushis sur place! Les employés sont extrêmement sympathiques et n'hésitent pas à conseiller les clients. Lorsque j'y suis allée, un vendredi soir, le service a été vraiment rapide.   Bref, le Sushis Shop du village est accueillant et leurs sushis sont très bons et frais. On ne fait pas de détour pour y aller, mais lorsque l'on a une rage de sushi et que l'on est dans le coin, un arrêt s'impose!

It's been awhile since i've eaten sushis from a Sushi Shop banner. Now i remember why. Everything tasted the same. Felix took a ready-made to-go assortment and ordered a few extras. Big difference in freshness there! I don't know why we decided to give it another try but will not do it again. The man working there, probably the owner, was very sweet and nice!

I was honestly disappointed with the sushi burrito here. First off the burrito took forever to make. Second I feel it was overpriced. Third I feel the flavor wasn't there and I need to pay an extra 60cts just to get a side order of spicy mayo.  This is the last thing so my gf is allergic to fish and wanted to get a burrito with only crab meat. They did not want to adjust to her allergy and make it for here even though they are made fresh as they say. This place is a joke and wouldn't make it back home.   Prices, flavor, service all below average = 2stars.
